newsitem.title: FRANCE: World Bank lends Algeria $89 mln for rural employment.
newsitem.headline: World Bank lends Algeria $89 mln for rural employment.

text.p: The World bank has approved an $89 million loan for Algerian social projects to provide employment through labour-intensive natural resource management, the official Algerian APS news agency said on Wednesday.
"The projects will target an estimated 69,000 rural jobless in each of the Wilaya (province) of Tlemcen, Sidi Belabbess, Mascara and Ain Temouchent," the agency said.
The four provinces are in the north west of the country.
The $89 million loan is repayable over 17 years, including a five-year grace period, with interest charged thereafter at the World Bank's standard variable interest rate, it added.
Algeria's unemployement is estimated at 28 percent.
